page.title: 17RETIREMENT HOMES 06200219
page.content: THE GRAND HOTEL USED TO BE THE LARGEST HOTEL IN FRINTON.IT IS NOW BEING CONVERTED IN TO A RETIREMENT HOME.IT OVER LOOKS THE SEA AND THE GREEN- SWARD. THIRTY NINE ROOMS HAVE BEEN LET.THERE IS A T.V. ROOM AND A LOUNGE.THERE IS A CHAIRLIFT AND A NORMAL LIFT.IT COSTS ABOUT Â£200 A WEEK TO STAY THERE. THE OWNER TAKES A FEW OF THE RESIDENTS OUT FOR A DRIVE EACH WEEK AND THEY GO OUT FOR TRIPS ONCE A MONTH. THEY ALSO GO OUT FOR PICNICS ON THE GREEN_SWARD ON HOT DAYS. AS YOU WALK IN THE ENTRANCE THERE IS A CAGE OF BUDGERIGARS. THE RESIDENTS SAID THAT THEY HAD ALWAYS LIVED IN THE AREA. THEY LIKED FRINTON FOR ITS EXCLUSIVE SHOPS. THEY THOUGHT THAT THE TOWN WAS MUCH BUSIER AND MUCH LARGER NOWADAYS.IT HAD BEEN A VERY QUIET SEASIDE TOWN 30 YEARS AGO.
